intro: Monnina myrtoides, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Monnina myrtoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
